issue.title: No longer lookup zones for every MiqQueue.create
issue.body:
Right now `MiqQueue.put` has 5 round trips to postgres:

```sql
BEGIN
SELECT name FROM zones WHERE id BETWEEN ... -- <-- *****
SELECT * FROM miq_queue WHERE class_name = "" AND method_name = "" AND args = "" AND ...
INSERT INTO miq_queue (class_name, method_name, ...) VALUES ("", "", ...)
COMMIT
```

For every `MiqQueue.create` we were looking up all zone names in this region.

This PR looks up the zone names one time and caches for a little while.

### Reasoning

We do not commonly create or delete zones.
So incurring this cost on every insert is too expensive.
It has been optimized for the common case, the target zone is valid or empty.

### Numbers

Now we cache the name of the zones in our region and only lookup the names once

|       ms |       bytes |   objects |query |  qry ms |     rows |`comments`
|      ---:|         ---:|       ---:|  ---:|     ---:|      ---:| ---
|  3,418.6 | 46,775,089* | 2,102,720 |1,081 | 1,578.8 |      335 |`capture-one-1`
|  3,230.1 | 40,325,501* | 2,023,487 |1,017 | 1,452.6 |      335 |`capture-queue_names-1`

issue.title: Heartbeat for non-rails workers
issue.body:
Non-rails workers do not have access to their miq_workers database record or the MiqWorker class which has helpful values specifically for heartbeating.  We also can't simply set these in the run_single_worker process' ENV because Bundler.with_clean_env doesn't reload ENV vars after startup.

Make sure to pass these options to the child non-rails worker on startup.

Follow-up:
* Check heartbeat for workers in "starting" status (non-rails can't set their record to "started")

Required for:
* https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-providers-vmware/pull/836

issue.title: Ofer/311468 filter event by storage system
issue.body:
Added a new selection field in the events monitoring page to filter by a physical storage system.

Before:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62609377/186401699-d8ea71ee-1c36-4e45-9463-9dc50b47fec6.png)

After:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62609377/186402928-f87d02bd-f737-495c-8d2b-3c213b20a1f4.png)

The new field will show the connected physical storage systems and will filter by the selection.
- When entering the monitoring page from the storage manager page, selecting an empty set will present all the events available.
- When entering the monitoring page from a specific physical storage, an empty set will present the current physical storage events.

issue.title: [WIP] No longer lookup zones for every MiqQueue.create
issue.body:
We were looking up all zone names in this region for every queue record created

Now we cache the name of the zones in our region and only lookup the names once

|       ms |       bytes |   objects |query |  qry ms |     rows |`comments`
|      ---:|         ---:|       ---:|  ---:|     ---:|      ---:| ---
|  3,418.6 | 46,775,089* | 2,102,720 |1,081 | 1,578.8 |      335 |`capture-one-1`
|  3,230.1 | 40,325,501* | 2,023,487 |1,017 | 1,452.6 |      335 |`capture-queue_names-1`

This removes one query for every MiqQueue.create/update across the app

This affects every `MiqQueue.create` across the application.

We do not commonly create a zone. The zone creating clearing out the local region cache is really there to fix tests, and probably will not come into play in the lifecycle of the application. (except when they create the first messages after creating the zone - which would need a local queue bust and not a global one)

issue.title: Add support for building repmgr13 v 5.2.1
issue.body:
* Commit the contents of the enterprise db's repmgr src rpm (minus the binary) * Make changes to this src rpm specifically to deal with changes they made that are not necessary when using dnf modules. They assume PG 13 is installed in a separate directory than other PG versions. Using dnf modules, you only have one enabled at a time and can rely on PG in the same location regardless of which module version you use. * Update our dependency in appliance to use repmgr13 >= 5.2.1 * Add Dockerfile and build script to build repmgr13 NOTE: I've removed the ubi9/stream9 changes. They still live in 2 additional commits [here](https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-rpm_build/compare/master...jrafanie:update_repmgr_from_406_to_521_with_ubi9) with patch files...
More details

``` From dcc385819ba59ebdd8b4d3c756fa9a020c7e35ca Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001 From: Joe Rafaniello Date: Wed, 19 Oct 2022 16:12:00 -0400 Subject: [PATCH 1/2] Use ubi9/stream 9 No need for postgresql modules since pg 13 is the default in stream 9 Changes to get ubi9/stream9 working: 1) pgxs.mk is needed and provided by postgresql-server-devel 2) libpgcommon.a and libpgport.a are needed and provided by postgresql-static 3) Contrib repo now contains the postgresql-server-devel and postgresql-static packages so we need to enable crb 4) tmpfiles_create macro is either removed/deprecated and suggested to use tmpfiles_create_package with the newer systemd in ubi9/stream9. Note, postgresql-server-devel requires postgresql-private-devel which also provides libpq and so conflicts with libpq-devel. postgresql-static also requires postgresql-server-devel. libpgcommon.a and libpgport.a were excluded form devel packages and instead put into the postgresql-static package and discussed in a prior commit. See this bz for more information: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=784281 --- packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile | 17 +++++++---------- packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec | 3 +-- 2 files changed, 8 insertions(+), 12 deletions(-) diff --git a/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile b/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile index 52c5aa6..3bf793e 100644 --- a/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile +++ b/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile @@ -1,4 +1,4 @@ -FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi8/ubi +FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi9/ubi ENV TERM=xterm \ RPM_SPEC=repmgr.spec @@ -8,23 +8,20 @@ RUN ARCH=$(uname -m) && \ dnf -y remove *subscription-manager* && \ dnf -y update && \ dnf -y install \ - http://mirror.centos.org/centos/8-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-stream-repos-8-2.el8.noarch.rpm \ - http://mirror.centos.org/centos/8-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-gpg-keys-8-2.el8.noarch.rpm \ - https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-8.noarch.rpm && \ - dnf -y module enable postgresql:13 && \ + http://mirror.stream.centos.org/9-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-stream-repos-9.0-18.el9.noarch.rpm \ + http://mirror.stream.centos.org/9-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-gpg-keys-9.0-18.el9.noarch.rpm \ + https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-9.noarch.rpm && \ dnf -y group install "development tools" && \ - dnf -y install \ + dnf -y install --enablerepo=crb \ ccache \ clang-devel \ flex \ - libpq \ - libpq-devel \ libxslt-devel \ llvm-toolset \ openssl-devel \ pam-devel \ postgresql \ - postgresql-devel \ + postgresql-server-devel \ postgresql-static \ readline-devel \ wget && \ @@ -33,4 +30,4 @@ RUN ARCH=$(uname -m) && \ COPY . /root -CMD ["/root/container-assets/build.sh"] +ENTRYPOINT ["/root/container-assets/build.sh"] diff --git a/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec b/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec index d9ed435..f5a3f29 100644 --- a/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec +++ b/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec @@ -45,7 +45,7 @@ Requires(postun): initscripts Group: Applications/Databases BuildRoot: %{_tmppath}/%{name}-%{version}%{extra_version}-%{release}-root-%(%{__id_u} -n) %endif -BuildRequires: postgresql, postgresql-devel +BuildRequires: postgresql, postgresql-server-devel, postgresql-static BuildRequires: libxslt-devel, pam-devel, openssl-devel, readline-devel flex Requires: postgresql-server @@ -125,7 +125,6 @@ fi /sbin/ldconfig %if %{systemd_enabled} %systemd_post %{sname}-%{pgpackageversion}.service -%tmpfiles_create %else # This adds the proper /etc/rc*.d links for the script /sbin/chkconfig --add %{sname}-%{pgpackageversion} -- 2.37.3 ``` ``` From 4d7eec275f3a62a8f39f67c2c9f62d59ccfe0e63 Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001 From: Joe Rafaniello Date: Wed, 26 Oct 2022 18:28:20 -0400 Subject: [PATCH 2/2] network-scripts was deprecated in el8 and removed in el9, use replacement https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_enterprise_linux/8/html/configuring_and_managing_networking/assembly_legacy-network-scripts-support-in-rhel_configuring-and-managing-networking NetworkManager-initscripts-updown.noarch : Legacy ifup/ifdown scripts for NetworkManager that replace initscripts (network-scripts) --- rpm_spec/subpackages/manageiq-gemset | 2 +- 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-) diff --git a/rpm_spec/subpackages/manageiq-gemset b/rpm_spec/subpackages/manageiq-gemset index 9ae80a2..7c195de 100644 --- a/rpm_spec/subpackages/manageiq-gemset +++ b/rpm_spec/subpackages/manageiq-gemset @@ -34,7 +34,7 @@ Requires: qpid-proton-c # For Appliance Console Requires: libsodium-devel -Requires: network-scripts +Requires: NetworkManager-initscripts-updown # For scanning Requires: glusterfs-fuse -- 2.37.3 ```

issue.title: Add support for building repmgr13 v 5.2.1
issue.body:
* Commit the contents of the enterprise db's repmgr src rpm (minus the binary) * Make changes to this src rpm specifically to deal with changes they made that are not necessary when using dnf modules. They assume PG 13 is installed in a separate directory than other PG versions. Using dnf modules, you only have one enabled at a time and can rely on PG in the same location regardless of which module version you use. * Update our dependency in appliance to use repmgr13 >= 5.2.1 * Add Dockerfile and build script to build repmgr13 NOTE: I've removed the ubi9/stream9 changes. They still live in 2 additional commits [here](https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-rpm_build/compare/master...jrafanie:update_repmgr_from_406_to_521_with_ubi9) with patch files...
More details

``` From dcc385819ba59ebdd8b4d3c756fa9a020c7e35ca Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001 From: Joe Rafaniello Date: Wed, 19 Oct 2022 16:12:00 -0400 Subject: [PATCH 1/2] Use ubi9/stream 9 No need for postgresql modules since pg 13 is the default in stream 9 Changes to get ubi9/stream9 working: 1) pgxs.mk is needed and provided by postgresql-server-devel 2) libpgcommon.a and libpgport.a are needed and provided by postgresql-static 3) Contrib repo now contains the postgresql-server-devel and postgresql-static packages so we need to enable crb 4) tmpfiles_create macro is either removed/deprecated and suggested to use tmpfiles_create_package with the newer systemd in ubi9/stream9. Note, postgresql-server-devel requires postgresql-private-devel which also provides libpq and so conflicts with libpq-devel. postgresql-static also requires postgresql-server-devel. libpgcommon.a and libpgport.a were excluded form devel packages and instead put into the postgresql-static package and discussed in a prior commit. See this bz for more information: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=784281 --- packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile | 17 +++++++---------- packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec | 3 +-- 2 files changed, 8 issue.title: Add support for building repmgr13 v 5.2.1
issue.body:
* Commit the contents of the enterprise db's repmgr src rpm (minus the binary)
* Make changes to this src rpm specifically to deal with changes they made that are not necessary when using dnf modules.  They assume PG 13 is installed in a separate directory than other PG versions.  Using dnf modules, you only have one enabled at a time and can rely on PG in the same location regardless of which module version you use. 
* Update our dependency in appliance to use repmgr13 >= 5.2.1
* Add Dockerfile and build script to build repmgr13

NOTE:  I've removed the ubi9/stream9 changes.

They still live in 2 additional commits [here](https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-rpm_build/compare/master...jrafanie:update_repmgr_from_406_to_521_with_ubi9)
with patch files:

```
From dcc385819ba59ebdd8b4d3c756fa9a020c7e35ca Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: Joe Rafaniello <jrafanie@gmail.com>
Date: Wed, 19 Oct 2022 16:12:00 -0400
Subject: [PATCH 1/2] Use ubi9/stream 9

No need for postgresql modules since pg 13 is the default in stream 9

Changes to get ubi9/stream9 working:

1) pgxs.mk is needed and provided by postgresql-server-devel
2) libpgcommon.a and libpgport.a are needed and provided by postgresql-static
3) Contrib repo now contains the postgresql-server-devel and postgresql-static
packages so we need to enable crb
4) tmpfiles_create macro is either removed/deprecated and suggested to use
tmpfiles_create_package with the newer systemd in ubi9/stream9.

Note, postgresql-server-devel requires postgresql-private-devel which also
provides libpq and so conflicts with libpq-devel.  postgresql-static also
requires postgresql-server-devel.

libpgcommon.a and libpgport.a were excluded form devel packages and instead put
into the postgresql-static package and discussed in a prior commit.  See this bz
for more information:  https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=784281
---
 packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile  | 17 +++++++----------
 packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec |  3 +--
 2 files changed, 8 insertions(+), 12 deletions(-)

diff --git a/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile b/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile
index 52c5aa6..3bf793e 100644
--- a/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile
+++ b/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi8/ubi
+FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi9/ubi
 
 ENV TERM=xterm \
     RPM_SPEC=repmgr.spec
@@ -8,23 +8,20 @@ RUN ARCH=$(uname -m) && \
     dnf -y remove *subscription-manager* && \
     dnf -y update && \
     dnf -y install \
-      http://mirror.centos.org/centos/8-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-stream-repos-8-2.el8.noarch.rpm \
-      http://mirror.centos.org/centos/8-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-gpg-keys-8-2.el8.noarch.rpm \
-      https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-8.noarch.rpm && \
-    dnf -y module enable postgresql:13 && \
+      http://mirror.stream.centos.org/9-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-stream-repos-9.0-18.el9.noarch.rpm \
+      http://mirror.stream.centos.org/9-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-gpg-keys-9.0-18.el9.noarch.rpm \
+      https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-9.noarch.rpm && \
     dnf -y group install "development tools" && \
-    dnf -y install \
+    dnf -y install --enablerepo=crb \
       ccache \
       clang-devel \
       flex \
-      libpq \
-      libpq-devel \
       libxslt-devel \
       llvm-toolset \
       openssl-devel \
       pam-devel \
       postgresql \
-      postgresql-devel \
+      postgresql-server-devel \
       postgresql-static \
       readline-devel \
       wget && \
@@ -33,4 +30,4 @@ RUN ARCH=$(uname -m) && \
 
 COPY . /root
 
-CMD ["/root/container-assets/build.sh"]
+ENTRYPOINT ["/root/container-assets/build.sh"]
diff --git a/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec b/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec
index d9ed435..f5a3f29 100644
--- a/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec
+++ b/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec
@@ -45,7 +45,7 @@ Requires(postun):   initscripts
 Group:        Applications/Databases
 BuildRoot:        %{_tmppath}/%{name}-%{version}%{extra_version}-%{release}-root-%(%{__id_u} -n)
 %endif
-BuildRequires:    postgresql, postgresql-devel
+BuildRequires:    postgresql, postgresql-server-devel, postgresql-static
 BuildRequires:    libxslt-devel, pam-devel, openssl-devel, readline-devel flex
 Requires:    postgresql-server
 
@@ -125,7 +125,6 @@ fi
 /sbin/ldconfig
 %if %{systemd_enabled}
 %systemd_post %{sname}-%{pgpackageversion}.service
-%tmpfiles_create
 %else
 # This adds the proper /etc/rc*.d links for the script
 /sbin/chkconfig --add %{sname}-%{pgpackageversion}
-- 
2.37.3

```

```
From 4d7eec275f3a62a8f39f67c2c9f62d59ccfe0e63 Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: Joe Rafaniello <jrafanie@gmail.com>
Date: Wed, 26 Oct 2022 18:28:20 -0400
Subject: [PATCH 2/2] network-scripts was deprecated in el8 and removed in el9,
 use replacement

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_enterprise_linux/8/html/configuring_and_managing_networking/assembly_legacy-network-scripts-support-in-rhel_configuring-and-managing-networking

NetworkManager-initscripts-updown.noarch : Legacy ifup/ifdown scripts for NetworkManager that replace initscripts (network-scripts)
---
 rpm_spec/subpackages/manageiq-gemset | 2 +-
 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-)

diff --git a/rpm_spec/subpackages/manageiq-gemset b/rpm_spec/subpackages/manageiq-gemset
index 9ae80a2..7c195de 100644
--- a/rpm_spec/subpackages/manageiq-gemset
+++ b/rpm_spec/subpackages/manageiq-gemset
@@ -34,7 +34,7 @@ Requires: qpid-proton-c
 
 # For Appliance Console
 Requires: libsodium-devel
-Requires: network-scripts
+Requires: NetworkManager-initscripts-updown
 
 # For scanning
 Requires: glusterfs-fuse
-- 
2.37.3
```

issue.title: [WIP] Move queue_capture to provider metric_capture_object
issue.body:
extracted / Blocked:

- [x] #19511
- [x] #19506
- [x] ~~#19507~~
- [x] #19541
- [x] #19599
- [x] #19610
### Overview

- Cap&U is a single workflow that is used by all providers.
- It puts too many messages on the queue.
- It doesn't pacing itself and relies upon `put_or_update` to avoid some of the duplicate work.
- It takes hours to run because it hits the provider too many times, many of which are duplicate.
- The cache in the broker alleviates some of the duplicate calls.

This PR is focused on queuing.

### Before

- Queuing capture was mixed into Vm, Host, and Storage models.
- The different models and providers work differently, this was handled by `if` checks on the provider class.

### After

- Queuing capture is part of the provider's `MetricCapture` object
- The different models and providers are still handles by `if` checks, but since there is now a hierarchy, they can use traditional inheritance.
- zone, queue name, ems are only looked up once. This removes quite a few calls.

issue.title: Metrics C&U: Introduce batches
issue.body:
Part of #20071 (dependencies listed there)

depends:

- [x] https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq/pull/22199 ( first 6 commits)

metrics perf_capture and callback handle multiple targets

# Flow

perf_capture logic lives in MetricsCapture and obtainable via perf_capture_object method
It is ems specific and queues all work for an ems

```
generic worker:
  scheduler

ems_metrics_coordinator worker:
  => perf_capture_timer => perf_capture_queue => perf_capture_targets => perf_capture_target

ems_collector worker:
  => perf_capture_{realtime,historical}
  => perf_capture_callback (for Host nodes)

ems_metrics_processor worker:
  => perf_rollup_range
  => perf_rollup_range to derive cluster metrics
```

Read: The scheduler calls perf_capture_timer (via the queue)
      perf_capture_timer runs on the ems_metrics_coordiantor worker
      perf_capture_timer calls perf_capture_queue which calls ...

# Before

- perf_capture_targets calls perf_capture_target for each object/timeframe
- message queued for each object/timeframe
- host callback also called for each object/timeframe
- Task used for host callback synchronization to then add rollup when all are done.

# After

- perf_capture_targets calls perf_capture_target with a list of targets
- each ems can override behavior to best meet their needs.
- message queued per 250 objects (Vm and Storage)
- message has same ems, timefame, and type (Host, Vm, or Storage)
- message has same cluster (Host) -- no 250 limit
- host callback called for each cluster (with list of host ids)


# Implementation Details

- Still calling Capture#perf_capture on instance of Vm/Host even though passing target_ids. (instance is one of the targets)
- Wanted to support single target and not move too many objects around.
- The instance_id needs to be sent in the target_ids. (instance_id only used to get correct ems/MetricsCapture subclass)

# Performance

|         ms |        bytes |       objects | query |    qry ms |     rows |`comments`
|        ---:|          ---:|           ---:|   ---:|       ---:|      ---:| ---
|   13,536.0 |  68,468,583* |    10,935,195 | 4,062 |  10,199.5 |      820 |`perf_capture-before`
|    5,045.4 |  50,056,647* |     7,306,457 |    56 |   4,784.2 |      820 |`perf_capture-after`
|        56% |              |               |   99% |       53% |          |
|  701,835.6 | 467,283,634* | 1,180,566,804 |50,855 | 298,696.7 |   12,103 |`capture-before`
|  606,988.0 | 727,409,742* | 1,154,128,824 |38,897 | 236,385.4 |    9,692 |`capture-after`
|        14% |              |               |   24% |       21% |      20% | delta

5 files checked, 1 offense detected

**app/models/metric/ci_mixin/capture.rb**
- [ ] :exclamation: - [Line 25](https://github.com/kbrock/manageiq/blob/d1b21ac5444ab07c8204b9d678b4fbbd276bc1ad/app/models/metric/ci_mixin/capture.rb#L25), Col 87 - [Style/OptionalBooleanParameter](https://docs.rubocop.org/rubocop/1.28/cops_style.html#styleoptionalbooleanparameter) - Prefer keyword arguments for arguments with a boolean default value; use `rollup: false` instead of `rollup = false`.

issue.title: No longer lookup zones for every MiqQueue.create
issue.body:
Right now `MiqQueue.put` has 5 round trips to postgres:

```sql
BEGIN
SELECT name FROM zones WHERE id BETWEEN ... -- <-- *****
SELECT * FROM miq_queue WHERE class_name = "" AND method_name = "" AND args = "" AND ...
INSERT INTO miq_queue (class_name, method_name, ...) VALUES ("", "", ...)
COMMIT
```

For every `MiqQueue.create` we were looking up all zone names in this region.

This PR looks up the zone names one time and caches for a little while.

### Reasoning

We do not commonly create or delete zones.
So incurring this cost on every insert is too expensive.
It has been optimized for the common case, the target zone is valid or empty.

### Numbers

Now we cache the name of the zones in our region and only lookup the names once

|       ms |       bytes |   objects |query |  qry ms |     rows |`comments`
|      ---:|         ---:|       ---:|  ---:|     ---:|      ---:| ---
|  3,418.6 | 46,775,089* | 2,102,720 |1,081 | 1,578.8 |      335 |`capture-one-1`
|  3,230.1 | 40,325,501* | 2,023,487 |1,017 | 1,452.6 |      335 |`capture-queue_names-1`

issue.title: Heartbeat for non-rails workers
issue.body:
Non-rails workers do not have access to their miq_workers database record or the MiqWorker class which has helpful values specifically for heartbeating.  We also can't simply set these in the run_single_worker process' ENV because Bundler.with_clean_env doesn't reload ENV vars after startup.

Make sure to pass these options to the child non-rails worker on startup.

Follow-up:
* Check heartbeat for workers in "starting" status (non-rails can't set their record to "started")

Required for:
* https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-providers-vmware/pull/836

issue.title: Ofer/311468 filter event by storage system
issue.body:
Added a new selection field in the events monitoring page to filter by a physical storage system.

Before:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62609377/186401699-d8ea71ee-1c36-4e45-9463-9dc50b47fec6.png)

After:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62609377/186402928-f87d02bd-f737-495c-8d2b-3c213b20a1f4.png)

The new field will show the connected physical storage systems and will filter by the selection.
- When entering the monitoring page from the storage manager page, selecting an empty set will present all the events available.
- When entering the monitoring page from a specific physical storage, an empty set will present the current physical storage events.

issue.title: [WIP] Heartbeat for non-rails workers
issue.body:
Non-rails workers do not have access to their miq_workers database record or the MiqWorker class which has helpful values specifically for heartbeating.  We also can't simply set these in the run_single_worker process' ENV because Bundler.with_clean_env doesn't reload ENV vars after startup.

Make sure to pass these options to the child non-rails worker on startup.

TODO:
- [ ] Check heartbeat for workers in "starting" status (non-rails can't set their record to "started")

Required for:
* https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-providers-vmware/pull/836

issue.title: [WIP] No longer lookup zones for every MiqQueue.create
issue.body:
We were looking up all zone names in this region for every queue record created

Now we cache the name of the zones in our region and only lookup the names once

|       ms |       bytes |   objects |query |  qry ms |     rows |`comments`
|      ---:|         ---:|       ---:|  ---:|     ---:|      ---:| ---
|  3,418.6 | 46,775,089* | 2,102,720 |1,081 | 1,578.8 |      335 |`capture-one-1`
|  3,230.1 | 40,325,501* | 2,023,487 |1,017 | 1,452.6 |      335 |`capture-queue_names-1`

This removes one query for every MiqQueue.create/update across the app

This affects every `MiqQueue.create` across the application.

We do not commonly create a zone. The zone creating clearing out the local region cache is really there to fix tests, and probably will not come into play in the lifecycle of the application. (except when they create the first messages after creating the zone - which would need a local queue bust and not a global one)

issue.title: Add support for building repmgr13 v 5.2.1
issue.body:
* Commit the contents of the enterprise db's repmgr src rpm (minus the binary) * Make changes to this src rpm specifically to deal with changes they made that are not necessary when using dnf modules. They assume PG 13 is installed in a separate directory than other PG versions. Using dnf modules, you only have one enabled at a time and can rely on PG in the same location regardless of which module version you use. * Update our dependency in appliance to use repmgr13 >= 5.2.1 * Add Dockerfile and build script to build repmgr13 NOTE: I've removed the ubi9/stream9 changes. They still live in 2 additional commits [here](https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-rpm_build/compare/master...jrafanie:update_repmgr_from_406_to_521_with_ubi9) with patch files...
More details

``` From dcc385819ba59ebdd8b4d3c756fa9a020c7e35ca Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001 From: Joe Rafaniello Date: Wed, 19 Oct 2022 16:12:00 -0400 Subject: [PATCH 1/2] Use ubi9/stream 9 No need for postgresql modules since pg 13 is the default in stream 9 Changes to get ubi9/stream9 working: 1) pgxs.mk is needed and provided by postgresql-server-devel 2) libpgcommon.a and libpgport.a are needed and provided by postgresql-static 3) Contrib repo now contains the postgresql-server-devel and postgresql-static packages so we need to enable crb 4) tmpfiles_create macro is either removed/deprecated and suggested to use tmpfiles_create_package with the newer systemd in ubi9/stream9. Note, postgresql-server-devel requires postgresql-private-devel which also provides libpq and so conflicts with libpq-devel. postgresql-static also requires postgresql-server-devel. libpgcommon.a and libpgport.a were excluded form devel packages and instead put into the postgresql-static package and discussed in a prior commit. See this bz for more information: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=784281 --- packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile | 17 +++++++---------- packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec | 3 +-- 2 files changed, 8 insertions(+), 12 deletions(-) diff --git a/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile b/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile index 52c5aa6..3bf793e 100644 --- a/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile +++ b/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile @@ -1,4 +1,4 @@ -FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi8/ubi +FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi9/ubi ENV TERM=xterm \ RPM_SPEC=repmgr.spec @@ -8,23 +8,20 @@ RUN ARCH=$(uname -m) && \ dnf -y remove *subscription-manager* && \ dnf -y update && \ dnf -y install \ - http://mirror.centos.org/centos/8-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-stream-repos-8-2.el8.noarch.rpm \ - http://mirror.centos.org/centos/8-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-gpg-keys-8-2.el8.noarch.rpm \ - https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-8.noarch.rpm && \ - dnf -y module enable postgresql:13 && \ + http://mirror.stream.centos.org/9-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-stream-repos-9.0-18.el9.noarch.rpm \ + http://mirror.stream.centos.org/9-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-gpg-keys-9.0-18.el9.noarch.rpm \ + https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-9.noarch.rpm && \ dnf -y group install "development tools" && \ - dnf -y install \ + dnf -y install --enablerepo=crb \ ccache \ clang-devel \ flex \ - libpq \ - libpq-devel \ libxslt-devel \ llvm-toolset \ openssl-devel \ pam-devel \ postgresql \ - postgresql-devel \ + postgresql-server-devel \ postgresql-static \ readline-devel \ wget && \ @@ -33,4 +30,4 @@ RUN ARCH=$(uname -m) && \ COPY . /root -CMD ["/root/container-assets/build.sh"] +ENTRYPOINT ["/root/container-assets/build.sh"] diff --git a/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec b/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec index d9ed435..f5a3f29 100644 --- a/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec +++ b/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec @@ -45,7 +45,7 @@ Requires(postun): initscripts Group: Applications/Databases BuildRoot: %{_tmppath}/%{name}-%{version}%{extra_version}-%{release}-root-%(%{__id_u} -n) %endif -BuildRequires: postgresql, postgresql-devel +BuildRequires: postgresql, postgresql-server-devel, postgresql-static BuildRequires: libxslt-devel, pam-devel, openssl-devel, readline-devel flex Requires: postgresql-server @@ -125,7 +125,6 @@ fi /sbin/ldconfig %if %{systemd_enabled} %systemd_post %{sname}-%{pgpackageversion}.service -%tmpfiles_create %else # This adds the proper /etc/rc*.d links for the script /sbin/chkconfig --add %{sname}-%{pgpackageversion} -- 2.37.3 ``` ``` From NetworkManager-initscripts-updown.noarch : Legacy ifup/ifdown scripts for NetworkManager that replace initscripts (network-scripts) --- rpm_spec/subpackages/manageiq-gemset | 2 +- 1 file changed, 1 b/rpm_spec/subpackages/manageiq-gemset @@ -34,7 +34,7 @@ Requires: qpid-proton-c # For Appliance Console Requires: libsodium-devel -Requires: network-scripts +Requires: issue.title: Add support for building repmgr13 v 5.2.1
issue.body:
* Commit the contents of the enterprise db's repmgr src rpm (minus the binary) * Make changes to this src rpm specifically to deal with changes they made that are not necessary when using dnf modules. They assume PG 13 is installed in a separate directory than other PG versions. Using dnf modules, you only have one enabled at a time and can rely on PG in the same location regardless of which module version you use. * Update our dependency in appliance to use repmgr13 >= 5.2.1 * Add Dockerfile and build script to build repmgr13 NOTE: I've removed the ubi9/stream9 changes. They still live in 2 additional commits [here](https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-rpm_build/compare/master...jrafanie:update_repmgr_from_406_to_521_with_ubi9) with patch files...
More details

``` From dcc385819ba59ebdd8b4d3c756fa9a020c7e35ca Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001 From: Joe Rafaniello Date: Wed, 19 Oct 2022 16:12:00 -0400 Subject: [PATCH 1/2] Use ubi9/stream 9 No need for postgresql modules since pg 13 is the default in stream 9 Changes to get ubi9/stream9 working: 1) pgxs.mk is needed and provided by postgresql-server-devel 2) libpgcommon.a and libpgport.a are needed and provided by postgresql-static 3) Contrib repo now contains the postgresql-server-devel and postgresql-static packages so we need to enable crb 4) tmpfiles_create macro is either removed/deprecated and suggested to use tmpfiles_create_package with the newer systemd in ubi9/stream9. Note, postgresql-server-devel requires postgresql-private-devel which also provides libpq and so conflicts with libpq-devel. postgresql-static also requires postgresql-server-devel. libpgcommon.a and libpgport.a were excluded form devel packages and instead put into the postgresql-static package and discussed in a prior commit. See this bz for more information: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=784281 --- packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile | 17 +++++++---------- packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec | 3 +-- 2 files changed, 8 insertions(+), 12 deletions(-) diff --git a/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile b/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile index 52c5aa6..3bf793e 100644 --- a/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile +++ b/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile @@ -1,4 +1,4 @@ -FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi8/ubi +FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi9/ubi ENV TERM=xterm \ RPM_SPEC=repmgr.spec @@ -8,23 +8,20 @@ RUN ARCH=$(uname -m) && \ dnf -y remove *subscription-manager* && \ dnf -y update && \ dnf -y install \ - http://mirror.centos.org/centos/8-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-stream-repos-8-2.el8.noarch.rpm \ - http://mirror.centos.org/centos/8-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-gpg-keys-8-2.el8.noarch.rpm \ - https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-8.noarch.rpm && \ - dnf -y module enable postgresql:13 && \ + http://mirror.stream.centos.org/9-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-stream-repos-9.0-18.el9.noarch.rpm \ + http://mirror.stream.centos.org/9-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-gpg-keys-9.0-18.el9.noarch.rpm \ + https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-9.noarch.rpm && \ dnf -y group install "development tools" && \ - dnf -y install \ + dnf -y install --enablerepo=crb \ ccache \ clang-devel \ flex \ - libpq \ - libpq-devel \ libxslt-devel \ llvm-toolset \ openssl-devel \ pam-devel \ postgresql \ - postgresql-devel \ + postgresql-server-devel \ postgresql-static \ readline-devel \ wget && \ @@ -33,4 +30,4 @@ RUN ARCH=$(uname -m) && \ COPY . /root -CMD ["/root/container-assets/build.sh"] +ENTRYPOINT ["/root/container-assets/build.sh"] diff --git a/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec b/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec index d9ed435..f5a3f29 100644 --- a/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec +++ b/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec @@ -45,7 +45,7 @@ Requires(postun): initscripts Group: Applications/Databases BuildRoot: %{_tmppath}/%{name}-%{version}%{extra_version}-%{release}-root-%(%{__id_u} -n) %endif -BuildRequires: postgresql, postgresql-devel +BuildRequires: postgresql, postgresql-server-devel, postgresql-static BuildRequires: libxslt-devel, pam-devel, openssl-devel, readline-devel flex Requires: postgresql-server @@ -125,7 +125,6 @@ fi /sbin/ldconfig %if %{systemd_enabled} %systemd_post %{sname}-%{pgpackageversion}.service -%tmpfiles_create %else # This adds the proper /etc/rc*.d links for the script /sbin/chkconfig --add %{sname}-%{pgpackageversion} -- 2.37.3 ``` ``` From issue.title: Add support for building repmgr13 v 5.2.1
issue.body:
* Commit the contents of the enterprise db's repmgr src rpm (minus the binary)
* Make changes to this src rpm specifically to deal with changes they made that are not necessary when using dnf modules.  They assume PG 13 is installed in a separate directory than other PG versions.  Using dnf modules, you only have one enabled at a time and can rely on PG in the same location regardless of which module version you use. 
* Update our dependency in appliance to use repmgr13 >= 5.2.1
* Add Dockerfile and build script to build repmgr13

NOTE:  I've removed the ubi9/stream9 changes.

They still live in 2 additional commits [here](https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-rpm_build/compare/master...jrafanie:update_repmgr_from_406_to_521_with_ubi9)
with patch files:

```
From dcc385819ba59ebdd8b4d3c756fa9a020c7e35ca Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: Joe Rafaniello <jrafanie@gmail.com>
Date: Wed, 19 Oct 2022 16:12:00 -0400
Subject: [PATCH 1/2] Use ubi9/stream 9

No need for postgresql modules since pg 13 is the default in stream 9

Changes to get ubi9/stream9 working:

1) pgxs.mk is needed and provided by postgresql-server-devel
2) libpgcommon.a and libpgport.a are needed and provided by postgresql-static
3) Contrib repo now contains the postgresql-server-devel and postgresql-static
packages so we need to enable crb
4) tmpfiles_create macro is either removed/deprecated and suggested to use
tmpfiles_create_package with the newer systemd in ubi9/stream9.

Note, postgresql-server-devel requires postgresql-private-devel which also
provides libpq and so conflicts with libpq-devel.  postgresql-static also
requires postgresql-server-devel.

libpgcommon.a and libpgport.a were excluded form devel packages and instead put
into the postgresql-static package and discussed in a prior commit.  See this bz
for more information:  https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=784281
---
 packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile  | 17 +++++++----------
 packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec |  3 +--
 2 files changed, 8 insertions(+), 12 deletions(-)

diff --git a/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile b/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile
index 52c5aa6..3bf793e 100644
--- a/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile
+++ b/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi8/ubi
+FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi9/ubi
 
 ENV TERM=xterm \
     RPM_SPEC=repmgr.spec
@@ -8,23 +8,20 @@ RUN ARCH=$(uname -m) && \
     dnf -y remove *subscription-manager* && \
     dnf -y update && \
     dnf -y install \

       ccache \

-      libpq \
-      libpq-devel \
       libxslt-devel \
       llvm-toolset \
       openssl-devel \
       pam-devel \
       postgresql \
-      postgresql-devel \
+      postgresql-server-devel \
       postgresql-static \
       readline-devel \
       wget && \
@@ -33,4 +30,4 @@ RUN ARCH=$(uname -m) && \
 
 COPY . /root
 
-CMD ["/root/container-assets/build.sh"]
+ENTRYPOINT ["/root/container-assets/build.sh"]
diff --git a/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec b/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec

 BuildRequires:    libxslt-devel, pam-devel, openssl-devel, readline-devel flex

@@ -125,7 +125,6 @@ fi
 /sbin/ldconfig
 %if %{systemd_enabled}
 %systemd_post %{sname}-%{pgpackageversion}.service
-%tmpfiles_create

 # This adds the proper /etc/rc*.d links for the script

issue.title: [WIP] Move queue_capture to provider metric_capture_object
issue.body:
extracted / Blocked:

- [x] #19511
- [x] #19506
- [x] ~~#19507~~
- [x] #19541
- [x] #19599
- [x] #19610
### Overview

- Cap&U is a single workflow that is used by all providers.
- It puts too many messages on the queue.
- It doesn't pacing itself and relies upon `put_or_update` to avoid some of the duplicate work.
- It takes hours to run because it hits the provider too many times, many of which are duplicate.
- The cache in the broker alleviates some of the duplicate calls.

This PR is focused on queuing.

### Before

- Queuing capture was mixed into Vm, Host, and Storage models.
- The different models and providers work differently, this was handled by `if` checks on the provider class.

### After

- Queuing capture is part of the provider's `MetricCapture` object
- The different models and providers are still handles by `if` checks, but since there is now a hierarchy, they can use traditional inheritance.
- zone, queue name, ems are only looked up once. This removes quite a few calls.

issue.title: Metrics C&U: Introduce batches
issue.body:
Part of #20071 (dependencies listed there)

depends:

- [x] https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq/pull/22199 ( first 6 commits)

metrics perf_capture and callback handle multiple targets

# Flow

perf_capture logic lives in MetricsCapture and obtainable via perf_capture_object method
It is ems specific and queues all work for an ems

```
generic worker:
  scheduler

ems_metrics_coordinator worker:
  => perf_capture_timer => perf_capture_queue => perf_capture_targets => perf_capture_target

ems_collector worker:
  => perf_capture_{realtime,historical}
  => perf_capture_callback (for Host nodes)

ems_metrics_processor worker:
  => perf_rollup_range
  => perf_rollup_range to derive cluster metrics
```

Read: The scheduler calls perf_capture_timer (via the queue)
      perf_capture_timer runs on the ems_metrics_coordiantor worker
      perf_capture_timer calls perf_capture_queue which calls ...

# Before

- perf_capture_targets calls perf_capture_target for each object/timeframe
- message queued for each object/timeframe
- host callback also called for each object/timeframe
- Task used for host callback synchronization to then add rollup when all are done.

# After

- perf_capture_targets calls perf_capture_target with a list of targets
- each ems can override behavior to best meet their needs.
- message queued per 250 objects (Vm and Storage)
- message has same ems, timefame, and type (Host, Vm, or Storage)
- message has same cluster (Host) -- no 250 limit
- host callback called for each cluster (with list of host ids)


# Implementation Details

- Still calling Capture#perf_capture on instance of Vm/Host even though passing target_ids. (instance is one of the targets)
- Wanted to support single target and not move too many objects around.
- The instance_id needs to be sent in the target_ids. (instance_id only used to get correct ems/MetricsCapture subclass)

issue.title: Metrics C&U: Introduce batches
issue.body:
Part of #20071 (dependencies listed there)

depends:

- [x] https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq/pull/22199 ( first 6 commits)

metrics perf_capture and callback handle multiple targets

# Flow

perf_capture logic lives in MetricsCapture and obtainable via perf_capture_object method
It is ems specific and queues all work for an ems

```
generic worker:
  scheduler

ems_metrics_coordinator worker:
  => perf_capture_timer => perf_capture_queue => perf_capture_targets => perf_capture_target

ems_collector worker:
  => perf_capture_{realtime,historical}
  => perf_capture_callback (for Host nodes)

ems_metrics_processor worker:
  => perf_rollup_range
  => perf_rollup_range to derive cluster metrics
```

Read: The scheduler calls perf_capture_timer (via the queue)
      perf_capture_timer runs on the ems_metrics_coordiantor worker
      perf_capture_timer calls perf_capture_queue which calls ...

# Before

- perf_capture_targets calls perf_capture_target for each object/timeframe
- message queued for each object/timeframe
- host callback also called for each object/timeframe
- Task used for host callback synchronization to then add rollup when all are done.

# After

- perf_capture_targets calls perf_capture_target with a list of targets
- each ems can override behavior to best meet their needs.
- message queued per 250 objects (Vm and Storage)
- message has same ems, timefame, and type (Host, Vm, or Storage)
- message has same cluster (Host) -- no 250 limit
- host callback called for each cluster (with list of host ids)


# Implementation Details

- Still calling Capture#perf_capture on instance of Vm/Host even though passing target_ids. (instance is one of the targets)
- Wanted to support single target and not move too many objects around.
- The instance_id needs to be sent in the target_ids. (instance_id only used to get correct ems/MetricsCapture subclass)

# Performance

|         ms |        bytes |       objects | query |    qry ms |     rows |`comments`
|        ---:|          ---:|           ---:|   ---:|       ---:|      ---:| ---
|   13,536.0 |  68,468,583* |    10,935,195 | 4,062 |  10,199.5 |      820 |`perf_capture-before`
|    5,045.4 |  50,056,647* |     7,306,457 |    56 |   4,784.2 |      820 |`perf_capture-after`
|        56% |              |               |   99% |       53% |          |
|  701,835.6 | 467,283,634* | 1,180,566,804 |50,855 | 298,696.7 |   12,103 |`capture-before`
|  606,988.0 | 727,409,742* | 1,154,128,824 |38,897 | 236,385.4 |    9,692 |`capture-after`
|        14% |              |               |   24% |       21% |      20% | delta

issue.title: No longer lookup zones for every MiqQueue.create
issue.body:
Right now `MiqQueue.put` has 5 round trips to postgres:

```sql
BEGIN
SELECT name FROM zones WHERE id BETWEEN ... -- <-- *****
SELECT * FROM miq_queue WHERE class_name = "" AND method_name = "" AND args = "" AND ...
INSERT INTO miq_queue (class_name, method_name, ...) VALUES ("", "", ...)
COMMIT
```

For every `MiqQueue.create` we were looking up all zone names in this region.

This PR looks up the zone names one time and caches for a little while.

### Reasoning

We do not commonly create or delete zones.
So incurring this cost on every insert is too expensive.
It has been optimized for the common case, the target zone is valid or empty.

### Numbers

Now we cache the name of the zones in our region and only lookup the names once

|       ms |       bytes |   objects |query |  qry ms |     rows |`comments`
|      ---:|         ---:|       ---:|  ---:|     ---:|      ---:| ---
|  3,418.6 | 46,775,089* | 2,102,720 |1,081 | 1,578.8 |      335 |`capture-one-1`
|  3,230.1 | 40,325,501* | 2,023,487 |1,017 | 1,452.6 |      335 |`capture-queue_names-1`

issue.title: Heartbeat for non-rails workers
issue.body:
Non-rails workers do not have access to their miq_workers database record or the MiqWorker class which has helpful values specifically for heartbeating.  We also can't simply set these in the run_single_worker process' ENV because Bundler.with_clean_env doesn't reload ENV vars after startup.

Make sure to pass these options to the child non-rails worker on startup.

Follow-up:
* Check heartbeat for workers in "starting" status (non-rails can't set their record to "started")

Required for:
* https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-providers-vmware/pull/836

issue.title: Ofer/311468 filter event by storage system
issue.body:
Added a new selection field in the events monitoring page to filter by a physical storage system.

Before:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62609377/186401699-d8ea71ee-1c36-4e45-9463-9dc50b47fec6.png)

After:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62609377/186402928-f87d02bd-f737-495c-8d2b-3c213b20a1f4.png)

The new field will show the connected physical storage systems and will filter by the selection.
- When entering the monitoring page from the storage manager page, selecting an empty set will present all the events available.
- When entering the monitoring page from a specific physical storage, an empty set will present the current physical storage events.

issue.title: [WIP] No longer lookup zones for every MiqQueue.create
issue.body:
We were looking up all zone names in this region for every queue record created

Now we cache the name of the zones in our region and only lookup the names once

|       ms |       bytes |   objects |query |  qry ms |     rows |`comments`
|      ---:|         ---:|       ---:|  ---:|     ---:|      ---:| ---
|  3,418.6 | 46,775,089* | 2,102,720 |1,081 | 1,578.8 |      335 |`capture-one-1`
|  3,230.1 | 40,325,501* | 2,023,487 |1,017 | 1,452.6 |      335 |`capture-queue_names-1`

This removes one query for every MiqQueue.create/update across the app

This affects every `MiqQueue.create` across the application.

We do not commonly create a zone. The zone creating clearing out the local region cache is really there to fix tests, and probably will not come into play in the lifecycle of the application. (except when they create the first messages after creating the zone - which would need a local queue bust and not a global one)

issue.title: Add support for building repmgr13 v 5.2.1
issue.body:
* Commit the contents of the enterprise db's repmgr src rpm (minus the binary) * Make changes to this src rpm specifically to deal with changes they made that are not necessary when using dnf modules. They assume PG 13 is installed in a separate directory than other PG versions. Using dnf modules, you only have one enabled at a time and can rely on PG in the same location regardless of which module version you use. * Update our dependency in appliance to use repmgr13 >= 5.2.1 * Add Dockerfile and build script to build repmgr13 NOTE: I've removed the ubi9/stream9 changes. They still live in 2 additional commits [here](https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-rpm_build/compare/master...jrafanie:update_repmgr_from_406_to_521_with_ubi9) with patch files...
More details

issue.title: Add support for building repmgr13 v 5.2.1
issue.body:
* Commit the contents of the enterprise db's repmgr src rpm (minus the binary) * Make changes to this src rpm specifically to deal with changes they made that are not necessary when using dnf modules. They assume PG 13 is installed in a separate directory than other PG versions. Using dnf modules, you only have one enabled at a time and can rely on PG in the same location regardless of which module version you use. * Update our dependency in appliance to use repmgr13 >= 5.2.1 * Add Dockerfile and build script to build repmgr13 NOTE: I've removed the ubi9/stream9 changes. They still live in 2 additional commits [here](https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-rpm_build/compare/master...jrafanie:update_repmgr_from_406_to_521_with_ubi9) with patch files...

issue.title: [WIP] Allow pg 10-13, disallow 9 and below, warn on 14+
issue.body:
- [x] Manually test pg 13 appliance HA
- [x] Manually test pg 13 podified
- [x] Manually test pg 13 logical replication (locally) (rake development:replication:setup and teardown

This pull request now is very lenient as we allow pg 10-13 to accommodate 10 to 13 migrations.  It disallows 9 and lower but only warns on 14+.

Therefore there is only one dependency:
- [ ] Update appliance_console to allow either repmgr10 or repmgr13: https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-appliance_console/pull/192

Follow up work:
- [ ] Manually test pg 13 appliance logical replication
- [ ] Document out how users upgrade from appliances/podified with pg 10 to pg 13
- [ ] Update tests to use pg 13 image and do cross repo. See https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq/blob/1d140d7d3b4ebea9dcee7826fdfdb764b154dcd2/.github/workflows/ci.yaml#L26

issue.title: Add support for building repmgr13 v 5.2.1
issue.body:
* Commit the contents of the enterprise db's repmgr src rpm (minus the binary)
* Make changes to this src rpm specifically to deal with changes they made that are not necessary when using dnf modules.  They assume PG 13 is installed in a separate directory than other PG versions.  Using dnf modules, you only have one enabled at a time and can rely on PG in the same location regardless of which module version you use. 
* Update our dependency in appliance to use repmgr13 >= 5.2.1
* Add Dockerfile and build script to build repmgr13

NOTE:  I've removed the ubi9/stream9 changes.

They still live in 2 additional commits [here](https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-rpm_build/compare/master...jrafanie:update_repmgr_from_406_to_521_with_ubi9)
with patch files:

```
From dcc385819ba59ebdd8b4d3c756fa9a020c7e35ca Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: Joe Rafaniello <jrafanie@gmail.com>
Date: Wed, 19 Oct 2022 16:12:00 -0400
Subject: [PATCH 1/2] Use ubi9/stream 9

No need for postgresql modules since pg 13 is the default in stream 9

Changes to get ubi9/stream9 working:

1) pgxs.mk is needed and provided by postgresql-server-devel
2) libpgcommon.a and libpgport.a are needed and provided by postgresql-static
3) Contrib repo now contains the postgresql-server-devel and postgresql-static
packages so we need to enable crb
4) tmpfiles_create macro is either removed/deprecated and suggested to use
tmpfiles_create_package with the newer systemd in ubi9/stream9.

Note, postgresql-server-devel requires postgresql-private-devel which also
provides libpq and so conflicts with libpq-devel.  postgresql-static also
requires postgresql-server-devel.

libpgcommon.a and libpgport.a were excluded form devel packages and instead put
into the postgresql-static package and discussed in a prior commit.  See this bz
for more information:  https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=784281
---
 packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile  | 17 +++++++----------
 packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec |  3 +--
 2 files changed, 8 insertions(+), 12 deletions(-)

diff --git a/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile b/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile
index 52c5aa6..3bf793e 100644
--- a/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile
+++ b/packages/repmgr13/Dockerfile
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi8/ubi
+FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi9/ubi
 
 ENV TERM=xterm \
     RPM_SPEC=repmgr.spec
@@ -8,23 +8,20 @@ RUN ARCH=$(uname -m) && \
     dnf -y remove *subscription-manager* && \
     dnf -y update && \
     dnf -y install \
-      http://mirror.centos.org/centos/8-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-stream-repos-8-2.el8.noarch.rpm \
-      http://mirror.centos.org/centos/8-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-gpg-keys-8-2.el8.noarch.rpm \
-      https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-8.noarch.rpm && \
-    dnf -y module enable postgresql:13 && \
+      http://mirror.stream.centos.org/9-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-stream-repos-9.0-18.el9.noarch.rpm \
+      http://mirror.stream.centos.org/9-stream/BaseOS/${ARCH}/os/Packages/centos-gpg-keys-9.0-18.el9.noarch.rpm \
+      https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-9.noarch.rpm && \
     dnf -y group install "development tools" && \
-    dnf -y install \
+    dnf -y install --enablerepo=crb \
       ccache \
       clang-devel \
       flex \
-      libpq \
-      libpq-devel \
       libxslt-devel \
       llvm-toolset \
       openssl-devel \
       pam-devel \
       postgresql \
-      postgresql-devel \
+      postgresql-server-devel \
       postgresql-static \
       readline-devel \
       wget && \
@@ -33,4 +30,4 @@ RUN ARCH=$(uname -m) && \
 
 COPY . /root
 
-CMD ["/root/container-assets/build.sh"]
+ENTRYPOINT ["/root/container-assets/build.sh"]
diff --git a/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec b/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec
index d9ed435..f5a3f29 100644
--- a/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec
+++ b/packages/repmgr13/repmgr.spec
@@ -45,7 +45,7 @@ Requires(postun):   initscripts
 Group:        Applications/Databases
 BuildRoot:        %{_tmppath}/%{name}-%{version}%{extra_version}-%{release}-root-%(%{__id_u} -n)
 %endif
-BuildRequires:    postgresql, postgresql-devel
+BuildRequires:    postgresql, postgresql-server-devel, postgresql-static
 BuildRequires:    libxslt-devel, pam-devel, openssl-devel, readline-devel flex
 Requires:    postgresql-server
 
@@ -125,7 +125,6 @@ fi
 /sbin/ldconfig
 %if %{systemd_enabled}
 %systemd_post %{sname}-%{pgpackageversion}.service
-%tmpfiles_create
 %else
 # This adds the proper /etc/rc*.d links for the script
 /sbin/chkconfig --add %{sname}-%{pgpackageversion}
-- 
2.37.3

```

```
From 4d7eec275f3a62a8f39f67c2c9f62d59ccfe0e63 Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: Joe Rafaniello <jrafanie@gmail.com>
Date: Wed, 26 Oct 2022 18:28:20 -0400
Subject: [PATCH 2/2] network-scripts was deprecated in el8 and removed in el9,
 use replacement

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_enterprise_linux/8/html/configuring_and_managing_networking/assembly_legacy-network-scripts-support-in-rhel_configuring-and-managing-networking

NetworkManager-initscripts-updown.noarch : Legacy ifup/ifdown scripts for NetworkManager that replace initscripts (network-scripts)
---
 rpm_spec/subpackages/manageiq-gemset | 2 +-
 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-)

diff --git a/rpm_spec/subpackages/manageiq-gemset b/rpm_spec/subpackages/manageiq-gemset
index 9ae80a2..7c195de 100644
--- a/rpm_spec/subpackages/manageiq-gemset
+++ b/rpm_spec/subpackages/manageiq-gemset
@@ -34,7 +34,7 @@ Requires: qpid-proton-c
 
 # For Appliance Console
 Requires: libsodium-devel
-Requires: network-scripts
+Requires: NetworkManager-initscripts-updown
 
 # For scanning
 Requires: glusterfs-fuse
-- 
2.37.3
```

issue.title: [WIP] Move queue_capture to provider metric_capture_object
issue.body:
extracted / Blocked:

- [x] #19511
- [x] #19506
- [x] ~~#19507~~
- [x] #19541
- [x] #19599
- [x] #19610
### Overview

- Cap&U is a single workflow that is used by all providers.
- It puts too many messages on the queue.
- It doesn't pacing itself and relies upon `put_or_update` to avoid some of the duplicate work.
- It takes hours to run because it hits the provider too many times, many of which are duplicate.
- The cache in the broker alleviates some of the duplicate calls.

This PR is focused on queuing.

### Before

- Queuing capture was mixed into Vm, Host, and Storage models.
- The different models and providers work differently, this was handled by `if` checks on the provider class.

### After

- Queuing capture is part of the provider's `MetricCapture` object
- The different models and providers are still handles by `if` checks, but since there is now a hierarchy, they can use traditional inheritance.
- zone, queue name, ems are only looked up once. This removes quite a few calls.

issue.title: Metrics C&U: Introduce batches
issue.body:
Part of #20071 (dependencies listed there)

depends:

- [x] https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq/pull/22199 ( first 6 commits)

metrics perf_capture and callback handle multiple targets

# Flow

perf_capture logic lives in MetricsCapture and obtainable via perf_capture_object method
It is ems specific and queues all work for an ems

```
generic worker:
  scheduler

ems_metrics_coordinator worker:
  => perf_capture_timer => perf_capture_queue => perf_capture_targets => perf_capture_target

ems_collector worker:
  => perf_capture_{realtime,historical}
  => perf_capture_callback (for Host nodes)

ems_metrics_processor worker:
  => perf_rollup_range
  => perf_rollup_range to derive cluster metrics
```

Read: The scheduler calls perf_capture_timer (via the queue)
      perf_capture_timer runs on the ems_metrics_coordiantor worker
      perf_capture_timer calls perf_capture_queue which calls ...

# Before

- perf_capture_targets calls perf_capture_target for each object/timeframe
- message queued for each object/timeframe
- host callback also called for each object/timeframe
- Task used for host callback synchronization to then add rollup when all are done.

# After

- perf_capture_targets calls perf_capture_target with a list of targets
- each ems can override behavior to best meet their needs.
- message queued per 250 objects (Vm and Storage)
- message has same ems, timefame, and type (Host, Vm, or Storage)
- message has same cluster (Host) -- no 250 limit
- host callback called for each cluster (with list of host ids)


# Implementation Details

- Still calling Capture#perf_capture on instance of Vm/Host even though passing target_ids. (instance is one of the targets)
- Wanted to support single target and not move too many objects around.
- The instance_id needs to be sent in the target_ids. (instance_id only used to get correct ems/MetricsCapture subclass)

# Performance

|         ms |        bytes |       objects | query |    qry ms |     rows |`comments`
|        ---:|          ---:|           ---:|   ---:|       ---:|      ---:| ---
|   13,536.0 |  68,468,583* |    10,935,195 | 4,062 |  10,199.5 |      820 |`perf_capture-before`
|    5,045.4 |  50,056,647* |     7,306,457 |    56 |   4,784.2 |      820 |`perf_capture-after`
|        56% |              |               |   99% |       53% |          |
|  701,835.6 | 467,283,634* | 1,180,566,804 |50,855 | 298,696.7 |   12,103 |`capture-before`
|  606,988.0 | 727,409,742* | 1,154,128,824 |38,897 | 236,385.4 |    9,692 |`capture-after`
|        14% |              |               |   24% |       21% |      20% | delta

5 files checked, 1 offense detected

**app/models/metric/ci_mixin/capture.rb**
- [ ] :exclamation: - [Line 25](https://github.com/kbrock/manageiq/blob/d1b21ac5444ab07c8204b9d678b4fbbd276bc1ad/app/models/metric/ci_mixin/capture.rb#L25), Col 87 - [Style/OptionalBooleanParameter](https://docs.rubocop.org/rubocop/1.28/cops_style.html#styleoptionalbooleanparameter) - Prefer keyword arguments for arguments with a boolean default value; use `rollup: false` instead of `rollup = false`.

issue.title: [WIP] Allow pg 10-14+ in dev, require pg 13 in production
issue.body:
- [x] Manually test pg 13 appliance HA
- [x] Manually test pg 13 podified
- [x] Manually test pg 13 logical replication (locally) (rake development:replication:setup and teardown
- [ ] Update tests to use pg 13 image and do cross repo. See https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq/blob/1d140d7d3b4ebea9dcee7826fdfdb764b154dcd2/.github/workflows/ci.yaml#L26

To be merged with:
- [ ] Update appliance_console to reference repmgr13 new locations and syntax changes: https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-appliance_console/pull/192
- [ ] Update to pg 13 in appliances: https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-appliance-build/pull/532
- [ ] Build repmgr13 against pg 13 and use it in manageiq-appliance: https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-rpm_build/pull/309
- [ ] Update container-postgresql to build image with PG 13 rpms https://github.com/ManageIQ/container-postgresql/pull/41
- [ ] Update podified to default to PG image tag `13` https://github.com/ManageIQ/manageiq-pods/pull/893

Follow up work:
- [ ] Manually test pg 13 appliance logical replication
- [ ] Document out how users upgrade from appliances/podified with pg 10 to pg 13
